00017 //: Render the pixels onto the frame buffer
00018 //
00019 // This renders the portion of the image within (x0,y0)-(x1,y1). The
00020 // whole image is rendered if (x0,y0)==(0,0) and
00021 // (x1,y1)==(w,h). (Actually, for efficiency, only the portion
00022 // overlapping the viewport is ever rendered.)  \a format and \a type
00023 // encode the data encoding in \a pixels. \a pixels is assumed to
00024 // store a row-ordered set of byte-aligned values.
00025 //
00026 bool vgui_section_render(void const *pixels,
00027                          unsigned w, unsigned h, // Size of image.
00028                          float x0, float y0,  // Region of image
00029                          float x1, float y1,  // to render.
00030                          GLenum format,
00031                          GLenum type ,
00032                          bool hardware_map = false,
00033                          vbl_array_1d<float>* fLmap=0,
00034                          vbl_array_1d<float>* fRmap=0,
00035                          vbl_array_1d<float>* fGmap=0,
00036                          vbl_array_1d<float>* fBmap=0,
00037                          vbl_array_1d<float>* fAmap=0);
00038                          
00039
